data.title: Olga Constantinovna of Russia
data.text:
Grand Duchess Olga Constantinovna of Russia (3 September 1851 – 18 June 1926) was Queen consort o the Hellenes an the wife o King George I. She also acted as regent of Greece.

Issue[edit]

Constantine I of Greece 2 August 1868 – 11 January 1923) married Princess Sophia of Prussia and had issue.

Prince George of Greece and Denmark 4 June 1869 – 25 November 1957) mairit Marie Bonaparte and had issue.

Princess Alexandra of Greece and Denmark (30 August 1870 – 24 September 1891) married Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich of Russia and had issue.

Prince Nicholas of Greece and Denmark 22 January 1872 – 8 February 1938) married Grand Guchess Elena Vladimirovna of Russia and had issue.

Princess Maria of Greece and Denmark married Grand Duke George Mikhailovich of Russia and had issue.

Princess Olga of Greece and Denmark (7 April 1880 – 2 November 1880) died young.

Prince Andrew of Greece and Denmark (2 February 1882 – 3 December 1944) married Princess Alice of Battenberg and had issue, including Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh.

Prince Christopher of Greece and Denmark (10 August 1888 – 21 January 1940) married Princess Françoise of Orléans and had issue.

Titles and styles[edit]

3 September 1851 – 27 October 1867 Her Imperial Highness Grand Duchess Olga Constantinovna of Russia.

27 October 1867 – 18 March 1913 Her Majesty The Queen.

– 18 March 1913 – 17 November 1920 Her Majesty The Dowager Queen.

17 November 1920 – 19 December 1920 Her Majesty The Queen Regent.
